title: U.S. fund Elliott seeks $670 mln from S.Korea over 2015 Samsung merger
text:
SEOUL (Reuters) - U.S. activist fund Elliott is seeking compensation from the South Korean government of no less than $670 million for damages it sustained from a 2015 merger between Samsung affiliates, according to a letter from the fundâ€™s representative.
FILE PHOTO: "Quantum Dot" SUHD televisions are displayed at the Samsung Electronics booth during the 2016 CES trade show in Las Vegas, Nevada January 7, 2016. REUTERS/Steve Marcus/File Photo The letter seen by Reuters and dated April 13 argued Elliott sustained loss and damage as an investor in one of the companies that merged.
Elliott began a legal dispute with South Korea over the merger earlier this year but had not previously revealed the amount of compensation sought.
Reporting by Joyce Lee and Ju-min Park; Editing by Stephen Coates
